Package org.webpki.xml

Class DOMUtil

java.lang.Object
org.webpki.xml.DOMUtil
public class DOMUtil extends Object
Utility methods for traversing and building DOM trees.

    • appendTextElement

      public static Element appendTextElement(Element parent, String element, String value)
      Creates a subelement with a single child, a text node, as a child of an existing node.

      The structure <element>value</element> will be created and appended to parent.

      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of the new element.
      element - The name of the new element.
      value - The value of the text node.
      Returns:
      Element

    • appendTextElement

      public static Element appendTextElement(Element parent, String element, int value)
      Creates a subelement with a single child, a text node, as a child of an existing node.

      The structure <element>value</element> will be created and appended to parent.

      This method is shorthand for appendTextElement(parent, element, Integer.toString(value))

      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of the new element.
      element - The name of the new element.
      value - The value of the text node.
      Returns:
      Element
      See Also:
      • appendTextElement(Element, String, String)

    • appendTextElement

      public static Element appendTextElement(Element parent, String element, long value)
      Creates a subelement with a single child, a text node, as a child of an existing node.

      The structure <element>value</element> will be created and appended to parent.

      This method is shorthand for appendTextElement(parent, element, Long.toString(value))

      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of the new element.
      element - The name of the new element.
      value - The value of the text node.
      Returns:
      Element
      See Also:
      • appendTextElement(Element, String, String)

    • appendTextElement

      public static Element appendTextElement(Element parent, String element, Object value)
      Creates a subelement with a single child, a text node, as a child of an existing node.

      The structure <element>value</element> will be created and appended to parent.

      This method is shorthand for appendTextElement(parent, element, value.toString()) and is hence useful when value is an object who's toString function returns a suitably formatted string representation, for example a StringBuilder, BigInteger or BigDecimal.

      Parameters:
      parent - The parent of the new element.
      element - The name of the new element.
      value - The value of the text node.
      Returns:
      Element
      See Also:
      • appendTextElement(Element, String, String)

    • firstChildElement

      public static Element firstChildElement(Element parent)
      Get the first child Element of an Element.

      Nodes other than Elements are ignored.

      Parameters:
      parent - Parent
      Returns:
      The first child Element or null if none exists.

    • nextSiblingElement

      public static Element nextSiblingElement(Node n)
      Get the next sibling Element of a Node.

      Nodes other than Elements are ignored.

      Parameters:
      n - Node
      Returns:
      The first child Element or null if none exists.

    • getSiblingElement

      public static Element getSiblingElement(Element e, String name)
      Gets the sibling Element with the indicated name. The sibling searched for must come after the given Element e.
      Parameters:
      e - Element to start search from.
      name - Name to search for in sibling.
      Returns:
      The sibling Element with the indicated name, or null if the Element could not be found.

    • getSiblingValue

      public static String getSiblingValue(Element e, String name)
      Gets the value for the sibling Element with the indicated name. The sibling searched for must come after the given Element e.
      Parameters:
      e - Element to start search from.
      name - Name to search for in sibling.
      Returns:
      The value of the sibling Element with the indicated name, or null if the Element could not be found.

    • getChildElement

      public static Element getChildElement(Element parent, String name)
      Gets the child Element with the indicated name. The child searched for must exist one level below the parent, i.e. a real parent-child relation.
      Parameters:
      parent - Parent Element to start search from.
      name - Name to search for in child.
      Returns:
      The child Element with the indicated name, or null if the Element could not be found.

    • getChildElementValue

      public static String getChildElementValue(Element parent, String name)
      Gets the value for the child Element with the indicated name. The child searched for must exist one level below the parent, i.e. a real parent-child relation.
      Parameters:
      parent - Parent Element to start search from.
      name - Name to search for in child.
      Returns:
      The value for the child Element with the indicated name, or null if the Element could not be found.
